sub_title: Data Scientist at Arval BNP Paribas Group
summary:
I like to solve problems and explore new challenges. Throughout my studies, I have been curious to explore more and try things that I thought are difficult like studying theoretical Mathematics while I was a practical programmer. My intellectual curiosity drove me into exploring my future goals and changing my career to find myself in the data domain. A big world of data that I found fun and challenging to explore and get insights from. 

I mixed my skills to be not only technical, but also professional and business-oriented. From being a programmer to volunteer with nonprofit organizations and being a user experience designer. I gained enough skills to technically explore the data insights and present it to the customers as a story. But that isn't all of it! I also consider myself a lifelong learner. I did a double major BSc in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics with a minor in Computational Science. Also, I graduated with my MSc in Computer Science with a specialty in Deep Learning. My latest obtained degree is Professional Doctorate in Engineering of Data Science which is, in brief, an industrial traineeship where I work with teams to solve data science challenges. 

In addition to my professional life, I love to draw what I see in real life and in my imaginary so I love to travel around the world to see new views and new people. I also like to build connections so if you ever want to share experience or ideas with me, please feel free to contact me: w.anbtawi1@gmail.com

profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
- Built encoder pollution prediction models
- Applied machine learning models to sensors data to detect failures.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
•	Designed a solid model that provides a data-driven recommendation on the number and type of cash registers for around 680 stores.
•	Analyzed stores performance, according to 400+ Million transactions using Spark in Databricks
•	Built a web scrapping tool to retrieve transaction records for the year 2020
•	Analyzed fraud implications for different types of cash registers
profile_positions.title: Data Science PDEng Researcher

profile_positions.description:
•	Completed four courses related to data engineering, data visualisation, data mining and statistics.
•	Worked on a variety of 2-months projects with 6 leading companies in the Netherlands:
o	Efteling: Created a visualization tool using Plotly dashboard to help Efteling analyze traffic within the park.
o	Audax: Analysed the associations between the products line, in addition to visualizing the product network graph using Plotly Dash.
o	ASML: Developed a text classification model to distinguish the text source for 5 machine log files, in addition, built a validation tool to validate the model using HTML.
o	GGD GHOR: Provided a social event risk assessment by calculating the additional risk score, and identified events tweets topics.
o	Brabant Water: Identified water discharge pattern, to help Brabant Water control damage.
o	TE Connectivity: Investigated the bottlenecks in the supply chain process, including delivery delays and system recording errors.
profile_positions.title: PDEng Data Science Trainee

profile_positions.description: •	Organized a 3-month Data Science Bootcamp that attracted 32 participants from 19 different countries.
